Ask HN: Can I see your scripts?
text:
A few weeks ago, I asked if I could see your cheatsheets (https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=31928736) and I was really impressed by all the high quality responses!

Today I'm asking about your scripts.

Almost every engineer I know has a collection of scripts/utilities for automating ${something}. I'm willing to bet that HN users have some of the most interesting scripts on the internet.

So that said, could I please see your scripts?

I'll go first: https://github.com/fastily/autobots

title: A planner app that stores data as plain text or md and has iCloud cal sync?
text:
I’m looking for an app to plan my freelance weeks/days. I’d like it to store data locally / on Dropbox / iCloud and in a way I can access it (plain text or markdown).

I’m also after something that lets me see my iCloud calendar events within the app.

Another plus would be a one off purchase - not a huge fan of subscriptions.

NotePlan is the closest I’ve found but the subscription cost is a turn off.

Sunsama is a really great app I think but also an expensive subscription and doesn’t sync with iCloud calendar.

I’m currently using Things 3 but it’s really not a planner in the way I want.

Will law become lucrative again?
text:
At the end of highschool in about 2010 I was pretty interested in becoming a lawyer. But all signs pointed to it being a terrible financial decision:

-law school grads I knew unemployed for years

-lots of debt, no way to pay it off unless you get into Big Law, need to be top 10 school

-highest rate of alcoholism (allegedly)

Too many law grads, not enough positions. Any sign this could change as the older generation phases out?
